abstract: It would require a microscope to detect changes in Microsoft’s behavior or in the software market as a result of the consent decree extended Tuesday by a federal court.
snippet: It would require a microscope to detect changes in Microsoft’s behavior or in the software market as a result of the consent decree extended Tuesday by a federal court.
lead_paragraph: The Federal District Court in Washington ruled late Tuesday to extend the consent decree against Microsoft for another two years.

headline.main: Microsoft Ruling: Split Decision, Two More Years of Oversight
